intro: Hibbertia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Hibbertia stricta produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a perennial shrub that blooms from late winter to early spring.
